label: Physical description
value: Medium: cardboard, linen, silk, metallic Technique: linen embroidery with ground cloth dissolved Examples of embroidery on net produced by the Schiffli machine Metallic embroidery on net Machine-made openwork in imitation of hand-embroidered net Mostly floral and a few geometric patterns, some designs described as "Spanish" Imitation hand-made filet Machine filet Imitation filet crochet Ploven (burnt-out lace) Fancy curtain lace made on the Levers machines Real filet (handmade) next to Machine-made filet Spotted curtain nets, made chiefly at Nottingham, England and Caudry, France.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The George Walter Vincent Smith Art Museum

label: Description
value: Natural linen cover with a continuous pattern of squares and rectangles arranged in stripes with small closely set rectangles for side borders. Initials "D.J. 7" embroidered in red linen on one corner.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 270 x 93.5 cm (8 ft. 10 5/16 in. x 36 13/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Curtain panels of black net with ochre cotton appliqué forming flowers and leaves outlined in chain stitch with tan and light brown silk or covered in chain stitch with white, pale and bright pink, yellow, tan or pale green silks. In center is a large basket with overflowing flowers and leaves suspended on two long ribbons from the top of the curtain. Sides and bottom are scalloped. Some of the centers of the blossoms have been cut out and filled with six threads knotted in the center to form spokes.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, silk Technique: appliqué on net

label: Description
value: Blue damask with a large scale symmetrical pattern, the vertical center-line is middle of fabric in light blue; large oval frame in the form of a ribbon from the top of which is suspended a basket of flowers from a ribbon.  The ribbon frame is the full width of the fabric, and is repeated one on top of the other.

label: Description
value: Flame stitch embroidery in an allover multicolor pattern of offset rows of flattened diamonds in knot-like diamond grid. Narrow outer borders with two-strand twin motif in blue and yellow.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: multicolor silk and hand-woven linen Technique: counted stitch embroidery

label: Description
value: Embroidered sampler. Silk on wool canvas showing Adam and Eve surrounded by plants and animals. Below, three moralizing Bible verses and figures with a brick house and large chalice. Meandering green border with plants and birds.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, wool canvas Technique: embroidered

label: Description
value: Neapolitan landscape of a courtyard with walls and columns visible on three sides. Ruin of a building at center, with smaller structure at left and four figures.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of Anne Duffy

label: Description
value: a) Diamond diaper pattern with bright blue crosses at intersection of lines. Reserves of ungrounded paper outlining pattern, diamonds filled with octa-pour on cream color; b) Bright blue band with red jewels, brown shaded and patterned bandings.

label: Provenance
value: These samples removed from the General John Frelinghuysen House, c. 1812, in Raritan, New Jersey. They were located in an attic room over the kitchen wing. See object file.

label: Description
value: Footed cup with two high looped handles.

label: Physical description
value: Glossy black and dark gray biscuit control-fired earthenware

label: Description
value: Flying or floating masked human figure holding a wand or a fan and a trophy head.  Embroidered in strong colors of deep brown, tobacco brown, blue, red, and ochre.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool Technique: embroidered in stem stitch on plain weave

label: Description
value: Book cover. Silk embroidered on linen showing geometric patterns in green, red, yellow and white on a blue ground. Silver clasps.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on linen, silver Technique: embroidered, chased

label: Provenance
value: Ex-collection:  Marian Hague; purchased from Kelekian.

label: Description
value: Long ochre-colored band with a scrolling pattern of a double-headed serpent.

label: Description
value: Cushion cover in an allover pattern of diamonds and rosettes, tassels on the edge. In red silk on linen.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on linen Technique: Rococo stitch embroidery on plain weave

label: Description
value: Chalice cover showing chalices with "IHS" and seraphims. In red silk on linen.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on linen Technique: embroidery

label: Description
value: Long narrow cover with a floral vine panel at each end; with fringe. Red silk on white linen.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on linen Technique: embroidered

label: Description
value: Long narrow border with a pattern of stylized plants at one edge in a row. In red silk on linen.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on linen Technique: embroidered
